area_name: Things Of Beauty (aka Interstate I-70 Towers)

climbs.name: Turkey Neck Tower
climbs.fa: Jeff Jackson,Duane Raleigh, Pete Takeda. summer 1993

content.description:
Turkey Neck is on the east of the alcove up to the right of The Fortress. Climb it from its short side of the tower. There is an attemted line with fixed anchors at the left edge of the spire. Pete Takeda: "It rises out of the hillside like a giant, raspy gizzard with a house-sized capstone overhanging on all sides.

Desent: rap from a single-bolt anchor back to the notch.
content.protection: Angle pitons (1) each; ice tool (1); hangers 0.5".
content.location: From the Garfield parking area hike for about 15 mins east parallelling I.70 pasted a fence line to an open canyon.

content.description: Mantis is located in the next major right (east) of The Fortress and Turkey Neck Tower. The route is obvious on the west face of the tower. Pete Takeda: "A wedge of mud, the Mantis is a thin rib of claycrested by a precarious series of isolated blocks. The blocks, perched on raised clay mounds, resemble bug eyes, lending an insect appearance. The 180' formation is split clean through by a crack".
content.protection:
Camalots (2) #3 through #4, pitons (5) 1/14 through 2": Bong-bongs through 4" (10-15), Spectres; 0.5" hangers.

Descent. There are no summit anchors. Lower off the backside. Pete Takeda: "To descend, Duane tied the haul line to the lead rope and rappelled off the opposite side using my body as a counterweight. To clean, I jumared the lead rope using his body as an anchor, and, for fear of being slingshotted off the tower, didn't dare peek over the summit ridge".
content.location: This is on Things of Beauty (a.k.a I-70 Towers), Palisade.

content.description:
The Regular Route ascends the left edge of the tower (40') as viewed from the south. Start at the high point of the ridge connecting the landform to the slope behind.

Descent: rap 40' from double anchors on the Dakota Sandstone capstone.
content.location: From the Garfield trailhead parking area, hike west along the dirt road parallelling I-70 for about 15 minutes past another fence line to an open canyon. Straight ahead is the blocky Fortress and up to the right is the Turkey Neck Tower.

climbs.name: The Fortress - The Prow
climbs.fa: Pete Takeda, Tyler Stableford, Duane Raleigh. spring 1993

content.description:
The Prow climbs the back side of the east end of the landform.

Descent: rap 40' from double anchors on the capstone.
content.protection: Spectres, long Leepers, pitons (3) 5/8" through 1 1/4"; hangers 0.5".
content.location: Hike about 15 minutes west from the Garfield trailhead parallelling I-70 past a fence line to an open canyon.

content.description:
High up above the main street of Palisade on the sky line can be seen a small spire. This is it! It was there, so went up it! There is very loose sandstone.

Eds. This spire has fallen over.
content.protection: One loose bolt to the summit and one loose bolt on the summit to retreat.
content.location: Walk the trail behind the crags above the town of Palisade that leads to the summit Flag. About one hour.

pathTokens: Things Of Beauty (aka Interstate I-70 Towers)
